detail_info.name_class: Geobacillin I (natural AMPs; lantibiotics, class 1 bacteriocin; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; XXT7;  UCSS1b; XXW2)
detail_info.additional_info: Although quite a few lantibiotics have been discovered, only one was found from thermophilic organism. Lantibiotics from thermophiles may have improved properties. This peptide was detected in five Geobacillus strains. Geobacillin I contains seven thioether cross-links, the highest degree of links in known lantibiotics. The thioether rings are as follows: S3-C7, T8-C11, T13-C18, T20-C24, S23-C27, S26-C30, and S29-C33 (determined by NMR). In addition, residues T2 and S5 are dehydrated into Dhb and Dha. This peptide appears to share rings 1 and 2 with nisin, but is more stable than nisin. Therefore, this peptide may be developed as a better version of nisin widely used in food preservation.
detail_info.reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 2012 Apr 3;109(14):5241-6.PubMed.
